messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 297
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/31/02 9:37:19 AM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/31/02 9:37:19 AM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< I really liked his book _River-Horse_ in which he took a boat from the
Atlantic to the Pacific, all via river. >>


That reminds me of a book I read called paddle to the Amazon. A Father and
son paddle all the way from Canada to South America....often with serious
risk to their lives. It's an amazing adventure story.
Can't remember the author though.

Ren

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 297
messages.msgSnippet: ... That s him.  I read that when I was just out of high school, and I ve STILL never gotten around to it.  :) Tuck
messages.messageBody:
>
>
>I really liked his book _River-Horse_ in which he took a boat from
>> the Atlantic to the Pacific, all via river.
>
>
>Isn't he the same guy who wrote Blue Highways, about traveling
>cross-country on the smaller roads (blue on most maps) and the people he
>meets and the things he sees? I read that 15 or 20 years ago and still
>remember it, and I've always wanted to do that.
>

That's him. I read that when I was just out of high school, and I've
STILL never gotten around to it. :)

Tuck
